ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Yes, take it if it is helpful for your research.
You get to learn about stat mech in the context of fluids and stuff. I'd recommend it because the prof knows his stuff.

Soft Matter is a class which talks about relevant physics for matter more solid than a gas and less solid than a crystal. If that sounds broad, then good (that's kind of the point). The lectures are relaxed and the work load is very manageable. Get ready to code.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: It made me more interested in soft condensed matter and introduced me to using computer code for solving physics problems.

This course exposed me to aspects of physics I had no background in especially statistical mechanics and osmotic pressure. This course was a revelation in the handling of complicated colloids and the problems which arise in their use. Since I work with colloids, there is a direct impact on my research.
It was helpful, but on an introductory level.
